description: A collection of all app and platform metrics for vLLM instances.

panels.description:
How much CPU time (in seconds per second) each container is using, summed over all cores, as a rate.

e.g., 2.0 using two cores fully
panels.title: CPU Usage Rate

panels.description: Memory actively used (excludes cache that can be reclaimed) in bytes.

targets.expr: sum(container_memory_working_set_bytes{job="kubelet", metrics_path="/metrics/cadvisor", cluster=~"$cluster", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container!="", image!=""}) by (container)

panels.title: Memory Usage

panels.description: Sum rate of cumulative count of bytes received/transmitted
panels.title: Network Throughput

panels.description: Cumulative count of bytes received/transmitted.
panels.title: Packet Rate

panels.description: Number of open file descriptors for the container.
panels.title: File Descriptors

panels.description: Cumulative count of bytes read/write.
panels.title: Disk R/W Rate

panels.description: Ceil of rated sum of cumulative count of bytes read/write.

targets.expr: ceil(sum by(pod) (rate(container_fs_reads_total{job="kubelet", metrics_path="/metrics/cadvisor", device=~"(/dev/)?(mmcblk.p.+|nvme.+|rbd.+|sd.+|vd.+|xvd.+|dm-.+|md.+|dasd.+)", container!="", cluster="$cluster", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval])))

panels.title: IOPS

panels.description: Rate of cumulative count of bytes read/write.

targets.expr: sum by(pod) (rate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{job="kubelet", metrics_path="/metrics/cadvisor", device=~"(/dev/)?(mmcblk.p.+|nvme.+|rbd.+|sd.+|vd.+|xvd.+|dm-.+|md.+|dasd.+)", container!="", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval]))

sum by(pod) (rate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{job="kubelet", metrics_path="/metrics/cadvisor", device=~"(/dev/)?(mmcblk.p.+|nvme.+|rbd.+|sd.+|vd.+|xvd.+|dm-.+|md.+|dasd.+)", container!="", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: I/O Throughput

panels.description: Total memory used (includes cache).
panels.title: Memory Used

panels.description: Mapped file memory (shared libs, mmap files) in bytes.
panels.title: Memory Mapped Files

panels.description: Swap memory used in bytes.
panels.title: Swap Memory

panels.description: Page cache memory used by container.
panels.title: Page Cache Memory

panels.description: Peak memory usage observed in bytes.
panels.title: Peak Memory Usage

panels.description: Resident Set Size (anonymous + file-backed memory in RAM) in bytes.
panels.title: Resident Set Size

panels.description: Number of memory allocation failures (OOM attempts).
panels.title: OOM Attempts

panels.description: Number of OOM events.
panels.title: OOM Events

panels.description: These all start with DCGM_FI_PROF_* Ratio of time the graphics engine is active. The graphics engine is active if a graphics/compute context is bound and the graphics pipe or compute pipe is busy.
panels.title: GPU Active Utilization

panels.description: Memory utilization.
panels.title: Memory Copy Utilization

panels.description:
Used Frame Buffer.

For high-performance computing and deep learning, framebuffers are critical for holding large datasets and intermediate values during processing, ensuring maximum throughput.
panels.title: Frame Buffer Utilization

panels.description: SM clock for the device.
panels.title: SM Clock

panels.description:
The number of bytes of active PCIe data including both header and payload.

Note that this is from the perspective of the GPU, so copying data from host to device (HtoD) would be reflected in this metric.

targets.legendFormat: RX Pod: {{exported_pod}} -  Node: {{Hostname}} - GPI: {{gpu}} - Bus ID: {{pci_bus_id}}
TX Pod: {{exported_pod}} -  Node: {{Hostname}} - GPI: {{gpu}} - Bus ID: {{pci_bus_id}}

panels.title: PCIe Throughput

title: vLLM Monitoring
